text:
Simpler neural networks such as the Multilayer Perceptron or MLP approximate a mapping
function from input variables to output variables. This general capability is valuable for time
series for a number of reasons.
 Robust to Noise. Neural networks are robust to noise in input data and in the mapping
function and can even support learning and prediction in the presence of missing values.
 Nonlinear. Neural networks do not make strong assumptions about the mapping function
